doc.field: Certificates and diplomas, report cards, publications and ephemera relating to Faithe Weisblatt and her attendance at three Brooklyn schools from 1939-1948: P.S. 184, J.H.S. 109 Straus, and Thomas Jefferson High School.

Certificates and diplomas, report cards, publications and ephemera relating to Faithe Weisblatt and her attendance at three Brooklyn schools from 1939-1948: P.S. 184, J.H.S. 109 Straus, and Thomas Jefferson High School.

A collection of materials relating to Faithe Weisblatt and her attendance at three Brooklyn schools from 1939-1948: P.S. 184, J.H.S. 109 Straus, and Thomas Jefferson High School. Includes certificates and diplomas, report cards, publications and ephemera. The collection also includes one undated publication from a camp, the Madisonian, of which Weisblatt was editor-in-chief.

Faithe Weisblatt attended P.S. 184 from approximately 1939-1942, J.H.S. 109 Straus from approximately 1943-1945, and Thomas Jefferson High School from approximately 1945-1948. She lived at 133 Powell Street in Brownsville.
These materials were found-in-collection in the Brooklyn Collection morgue and their source is unknown.
If digital surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.
